abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Asset Management Reform
            for Morocco were as follows: the outcome was satisfactory,
            the sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, the Bank performance was highly
            satisfactory, and the borrower performance satisfactory.
            Lessons learned from the project: It is important to seize
            opportunities when they arise. The operation was successful
            in large part because the proposed reform agenda came at the
            right time. Significant changes can be made with limited
            resources. Maintenance is too often delayed because of lack
            of funding. Experience under the operation has shown that,
            even with limited funding, significant changes can be made.
            Delegation to local levels and training are key elements for
            success. Initiation of the maintenance program worked
            because the central level delegated responsibilities to
            local teams, who were under pressure from the population to
            show results.
